name: Dedekind Domain
definition: A **Dedekind domain** is an integral domain in which every nonzero proper ideal factors into a product of prime ideals.
description:
A **Dedekind domain** $R$ is either a #field or an #integral_domain satisfying any of the following equivalent conditions (these are equivalent for an #integral_domain):

1. Every nonzero proper ideal factors into primes.
1. $R$ is #noetherian and the localization at each maximal ideal is a #discrete_valuation_ring
1. Every nonzero fractional ideal of $R$ is invertible
1. $R$ is an #integrally_closed_domain, #noetherian with Krull dimension $1$.
1. For any two ideals $I$ and $J$ in $R$, $I$ is contained in $J$ if and only if $J$ divides $I$ as ideals, i.e. there exists an ideal $H$ such that $I=JH$.
